comment: Professor Deng is great if you like to do your work and learning at home. I went to his class for weeks and could not understand a single word he said. He genuinely wanted to help & cared but his accent was just too thick. I dropped this class and took it with another professor with a lighter accent and have actually been learning in class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Online Savvy

comment: Professor Deng is definitely a very nice person. The only thing was that I couldn't understand a single word he said (I'm being very serious). The only reason that students pass his class is because he allows students to have cheat sheets on exams and is very generous with partial credit. If you struggle with math, I recommend taking someone else.

4 tests and a final exam. Only 3 out of those 5 count towards your grade. Minimal homework per exam, at least for a math course. Reviews look just like the test, and a cheat sheet is allowed on every test. Heavy accent, but relatively easy course.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Deng was a great calc 1 professor. He has a strong accent which is hard to understand at first, but it becomes easier as the semester goes on. His lectures are great. Tests are on the short side which is nice, and they're similar to the unit reviews. I am well prepared for calculus 2 which is great.

Professor Deng is a great professor. He does have an accent that is very difficult to understand at first, but he explains things well. Overall a great professor with a exceptional expertise of mathematics. The tests are short but on the difficult side. The tests are similar to the review. I was prepared for calc 2. Overall a great experience.

Calc 2 is a hard class but Deng makes it as easy as it can be, which is still really hard. The homework was on mymathlab and straightfoward, He has a thick accent but will make sure you understand if you ask. The online reviews are similar to the exams. He lets you have two cheat sheets. I got a C but I know I could've done better if I tried harder

Although he has a very heavy accent, you begin to understand him slowly. Most of his lectures just go over the notes he posts, and the test reviews are almost the exact test with a few numbers changed. Only 3 out of 5 tests count, so if you do well on the first three tests you can forget about the class for the rest of the semester. Best CALC2 prof
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Accessible outside class

comment: He's a solid teacher for calculus 2. Even though he has a heavy accent, but after few weeks it's probably getting better. In the classroom he will try his best to explain the new concept for you, and help you solving the problems. In the test, if you have something wrong he also give you some partial points too.
He is very forgiving with points on tests and you're allowed a cheat sheet. Best math class I've taken in years. No requirements and minimal work.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: Great professor! For a calc2 class, I was blessed to get him. He gave plenty of resources to be well prepared for the exams. Grade was made up of 4 exams, the final, and homework. And one of the exams was dropped. Heavy on the accent, but worth it! And he was very accessible.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria

comment: Dr. Deng is an amazing teacher. Difficult to understand at first, but very thorough. 4 tests + final; he only takes the top 3 test grades and homework counts for 1/4 of your overall grade. Grades fair, allows TI-84 and 2 pages of back/front notes on each test. 10/10 would take again. I got an A and I struggle with calculus.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Graded by few things--Test heavy

comment: Dr. Deng is awesome for Calc II. He does everything he can to give you the tools to succeed in Calc II and is a very polite professor. He has a heavy accent, however you get used to it after the first couple lectures. He will answer any emails or questions that you have. Take him if you can!

Hes very lenient with partial credit in the 4 exams he has. The only downside are his lectures can be a bit difficult to understand if accents are something you struggle with. As long as you do the homework and study a bit for the exams it should be an easy A or B grade.

Professor Deng is a really solid choice. Took him for ODE online during the COVID period. He made summer much easier for students. You are only graded by a few things also. I opted out of doing the HW and did 4 tests instead. I like that he gives you options.

He tries to help you out as much as possible to pass the class. I took this online class during the COVID pandemic, and he understood many students might be affected, so he made it so the class was as manageable as possible. Calc 2 is hard, and it's a good idea to attend class if you want a good test grade, as he runs through many example problems.

took him online over the summer, only attended one lecture. reviews are the same as test but diff numbers. grades are based on 3 Tests and hw. hw is on my math lab, there are 5 tests: 4 tests and a final. If you take 3 tests and are happy w your 3 tests grades you dont have to take the final & a 4th test bc he only takes the 3 best test grades.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Caring--Graded by few things

comment: His class was easier than expected. Theres 4 tests and a final that can replace your lowest test grade. Completing and understanding his study guides is key to passing tests. He also allows you to use a sheet of notes (front and back) on the tests. The concepts are hard, but he goes over multiple methods of solving problems. Would take again.

TAKE HIM! He does have a thick accent but you get used to it pretty quickly. Grades only from HW and tests, and attendance is taken randomly (usually when there are a small number of people at the beginning of class). His test reviews are similar to test questions, and you are allowed a note sheet for the tests.
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Clear grading criteria--Lecture heavy

comment: Professor Deng is a pretty good professor. He has a thick accent which sometimes makes him hard to understand. Homework and tests are the only grades. His lectures are somewhat pointless to go to as tests are directly from the study guide he gives out, just different numbers. If you are good at teaching yourself calculus, this is your guy.

Attendance is taken randomly and used only to decide boarder line cases. 4 tests and a final. Tests are just like the reviews. He does talk quietly. You can pass by just reading the textbook and doing the reviews (and homework, which gives unlimited tries). But if you can't teach yourself things don't take him (or any college class (sorry))

Good professor. I took this class for the summer. At first i thought this class was going to be super hard since I was taking it over the summer but it actually wasnt that bad. He gave us 5 quizzes but only counts the best 3 and we had two test. The final is optional. I didnt have to take the final I was happy with the B I made in the class.

Took Deng for calculus 3. Hes very passionate about math. Theres a language barrier but not too big of an issue. 4 tests lowest dropped replaced with homework grade, cumulative final. Reasonable test questions nothing out of left field. Tests are open book and youre allowed a cheat sheet. Gives good partial credit. An A is doable with effort.

Very nice and smart but hard to understand due to accent. Had to lean heavily on the book and internet because of this. Gives a few graded Webassign homeworks but most of your grade is 3 scheduled tests and a final. His tests contain very easy problems compared to the suggested book practice problems and he tells you exactly what topics you'll see.

Diff eq. Very nice professor. Showed different ways to approach problems and reflected back on earlier methods of solving comparing methods. Assigns HW but not graded. 5 quizzes lowest 2 dropped and two test with optional final. Quizzes roughly 40 percent. Final would replace 2 quizzes or one test.

You DO NOT get used to his accent. His lecture style during class is very hard to follow, he jumps around a lot which makes it confusing. The tests arent bad, you can use a review sheet that has very similar questions as the tests, you can also use the book. If you want an A take his class, if you want to learn you're on your own.

He's easy to pass, hard to fail, but you learn as much (A), or as little, (C), as you put in. He's great, teaches well. Accent scary, relax you get used to it fast. Repeats important material, which is very helpful. Calc 3 isn't easy, but it's very doable here. If you're not the best student & in a "Must Pass" scenario, (take Deng) + (study)  A.
His accent is tough to understand at first, but it is easy to get used to. Tests are easy to get A's on.

He's a decent enough guy but a horrible teacher. Can not understand what he's saying. His English takes getting use to but still. Homework certainly helps and should be done. His test aren't hard but he teaches some of what's on it and the homework doesn't have the rest. Do not take him if you want to actually learn something.

I really liked having him and with me having calc 2 in 8 am in the morning was interesting. It takes about a week to get use to his accent but after you do you will learn stuff easy. He has taught me many things and shortcuts to remember things that none of my math professors ever taught me. Homework is extra credit and allows cheat sheets on tests

Prof. Deng is a great math professor. His english isn't the best but you get used to it. He is very clear and some lectures get repetitive because he works a lot of the same problems but it helps to understand well.  Homework is online and is extra credit and helps alot. He lets you have a cheat sheet for every test and the final. Highly recommend

Pros: Gives cheat sheets for all 4 exams and final exam. Gives extra credit homework. Very knowledgeable and nice. Provides out of class help if needed. No quizzes. Easy grader on exams Cons: Takes about the first two weeks to understand him. Tends to repeat himself from previous classes.

Strong accent to get used to but reviews the same material first 10 min of class every class. He allows you to make your own formula sheet for test so make them good. Gives ALOT of extra credit so do all of your extra credit work!!!!!!! Easy grader gives a lot of partial credit. Go to his office hours for extra help.

Deng is the best professor for Calc 2. He has a heavy accent that took me 2 weeks to get used to but after I understood him well. Homework is optional and extra credit. Test questions are very similar to the ones on the review sheet he gives you plus he allows you one cheat sheet front and back. For the final he lets you bring in 4 cheat sheets.

Absolutely awful teacher, and extremely easy grader. If you want an easy A, feel free to take his class. If you want to actually learn something, look elsewhere. I can say that I have earned close to nothing from his class.

It's hard to understand him at first, but stay in the class for a week or two and you will start to. He is extremely helpful and covers everything over and over. That can be annoying but it is extremely helpful. Tests are like study guides. Definitely recommend!
Best math prof ever.  Makes things so easy to understand, and retain.

Fantastic professor. His teaching style and technique is excellent. He will make you truly understand the material, he does not try to make it hard for students as he wants you to succeed and learn. His handwriting is very neat, and he thoroughly proves/explains everything he expects you to learn. Highly recommended if you actually want to learn!!

Professor Deng is quite an impressive professor. He may not have be very clear in his English, but he's very good with his writing and his reviews are a good way to know what will be on the test. He's quick to reply via E-Mail as well, I'm very much taking him  for Differentials. Great man.

Good professor if you want an easy grade, but his lectures are very hard to understand due to his accent.  You will have to work hard outside of the class to understand the material, however he gives out study guides very similar to each of the tests so if you just want an easy grade, he's probably for you.

Great and very helpful teacher. go to his class everyday though the attendance is NOT required. As far as understanding him... you'll understand him. His accent isn't bad but you'll get use to it. Always do your homework for your own practice because same question will be on the test most of the time. I'd definitely recommend him for any math class

He is very helpful in comparison to other professors in the department. He loves math and really understands his material. Fyi..be prepared for corny math jokes that only he gets, because he thinks math is cool.

Easiest math class ever! He gives out a review page before he starts the chapter. He sticks to that page like glue. His test is that page so keep it and write down the answers he gives you. Lets you have a cheat sheet on each test. Only problem is you have to know the stuff for CALC 2 so study and know the stuff if you want to do well in the future

He is EXTREMELY hard to understand. He has a THICK Chinese accent and he talks VERY fast. We must have gotten too far behind in class because he started making a test every third class near the end of summer semester. He writes TINY and erases quickly so be attentive if you have to select him. Good Luck.. not really recommended.

Have taken 3 math classes with him, wish I could take him for every math class.  Very friendly guy and gives fair exams.  Homework is not mandatory but he often uses problems from the homework on exams.  Don't listen to anyone who says he is hard to understand; if you pay attention you can get used to his accent.
Great professor, had a good time in his class. He goes over most of everything on the test so you understand the material.
EASY CLASS. GOT AN A IN THE CLASS. LANGUAGE BARRIER BUT IT WAS A REALLY EASY CLASS I SLEPT IN CLASS OR LISTENED TO MUSIC AND ENDED UP WITH AN A.
I was a easy class. Go to class and you will get an A.

Deng is a very good teacher that explains how to solve the problems with little story telling or other crap that most math teacher like to do. he does have a thick accent, but you WILL get past it trust me. Like previously stated he lets you use cheat sheets on test and quizzes. After getting your tests back he gives you a answer key SAVE the answe
calc 2  was a breeze with Deng. I actually learned all the material by just watching what he was doing. tests were easy and final was easy as well.

BEST CALCULUS PROFFESOR! You can use cheat sheets, and textbook on test.  You will learn to understand Chinese in no time.  Very helpful and knowledgable about math.  Made Calculus bearable for a business major.  Highly Reccommend!

Took this professor over the summer. His accent is VERY thick and it does take some getting used to. Besides that he is a great professor. Does allow the use of a note sheet, calculator, and text book on all tests including the final. The study guides are basically the tests so do those and you will pass no doubt. Highly recommend this professor.

I really love the way he teaches.  He really makes clear points in class.  He doesn't make things confusing like other professors.  His syllabus is simple, 3 tests and a final.  He is a really nice guy too.  He gives open book and cheat sheet tests.  I really wish I had taken him for every math class I ever had.  Fortunately, I've taken him for 3.

If you can, take another teacher. The ratings on here said you would get used to the accent, not at all. He's extremely easy, but I couldn't understand anything he said the entire semester. I managed to get a B just because he doesn't count wrong answers wrong? Probably would be a good teacher, but accent is WAY to heavy.
Very hard to understand vocally

Deng was awesome...I had him for College Alg and CalcI. I mean it if I could take him for every math I would. He knows his math inside out and wants to make sure you do too. Don't be affraid of his accent trust me u'll find out that "naked anything" means negative anything.lol Just take his notes and u'll be ok.I highly suggest taking Deng!

Deng is a math genuius.  I took him for Calc 2 and I was totally amazed at how much he has a grasp on numbers.  I'm not great at math, but his "cheat sheet" saved my life.  If you try, then you will be fine.

I really liked him and learned alot. Would enjoy taking him again if I needed it. Accent is not hard to understand if you really pay attention. He really enjoys what he does and wants you to understand.

Never took attendance...Lots of notes, however, his accent is not easy to understand...His TA taught every other day, who was much easier to understand...gave lots of partial credit for quizzes, not so much on tests...Homework was NOT mandatory...Not my first choice, but the class was pretty easy.

His accent might scare you away within the first week of class, but stay because you will eventually understand that "naked number" means "negative number", so stick around because he lets you use notes for the tests, and the test are usually the same questions from the homework.

Make sure you show up and take notes.  Attendance is not necessary, but it's always helpful on the tests if you know what it's about.  I suggest taking him, it's not a hard class.  He's a good professor for this course.

Has accent but easy to understand until he gets excited and he is very enthusiastic about math, so hard to understad a lot. Jumps around, we were doing chap 1 and he was showing stuff from chap 5 and didnt tell us till after we were throughly confused. Or he will show stuff in calc 1 and then say you dont need know it till calc 2 or even upper math
The textbook in my opinion is useless.  His accent is pretty thick, but if you can get past it you'll learn a lot from his class. Also, most of his tests are the same problems he does on the board.
once you go to class and take good notes, you're set on the tests!

Great professor, very comical in class.  Deng knows his stuff all the way around.  His tests are not hard at all, just like the examples in the book. His accent takes some getting used to, but after that, its fine.  Take Deng if you have a chance.

Don't be afraid of this guy's accent, if you stay it becomes easy to understand.  Barely did any homework or studying and go a B.  You get four review sheets and a book to use on the final.  Would definitely recommend this guy.  Very fair

When they say he has an accent, they MEAN it. i was overwhelmed my first week there, but you definatly get used to it. personally, i love goin to the class cause i can't stop laughing through it all cause his manorisms are hilarious. He's fair, and his tests are pretty easy. If you go to class and do the homework, you should be fine.
No Comments
Class was easy. but cant understand a single word he said the whole time tests werent too hard. But has a strong accent.

Among the best professors in the dept.Has strong command of the material and offers assistance outside of class.If you do the HW and the review sheets, you'll do well.His English is allot better than most people say.I understood him very well.
Enthusiastic, energetic, seems to really know his stuff.  The kind of professor you want.  To bad I couldn't understand half of what he said.  Very heavy accent.

It takes two weeks to learn to understand this guy but he is really a good teacher. His grading is very liberal and you get a review sheet for every test which is almost exactly like his test. Once you get to the point you can understand what he says he is great.

Very enthusiastic about material and seems to be a nice prof...only problem is that you can barely understand what he is saying.  He has a VERY heavy accent and is extremely difficult to understand.   Would not recommend him if you stink in math.
